creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: top is carved as a five-petal blossom, with conforming sides supported on five bracket feet; small mouth has a beaded edge; dense, finely grained wood is a dark purplish-brown color
text: The top of this elegant, highly polished vessel is carved with a five-petaled mallow blossom. The small container would have held simple metal instruments used in the burning of incense.
title: Incense Tool Vase
